intro: Tithymalus sera-comans, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its leaves are narrow and sometimes hairy, and it is known for its delicate appearance. Tithymalus sera-comans is primarily found in regions of southern Europe and western Asia.
